configmultienum.name: apps
configmultienum.desc: Select any applications that should be linked in Passwd's menu

configenum.name: backend_list
configenum.desc: Should we display a list of backends (defined in config/backends.php) for users to choose from? The options are 'shown', 'hidden'. If the backend list is hidden then you can use the 'preferred' mechanism to auto-select from it based on an HTTP virtualhost or another piece of data. If it is shown, the user will be able to pick from any of the options.

configboolean.name: change
configboolean.desc: Should we allow the user to specify the username?

configlist.name: refused
configlist.desc: Define usernames for which we will refuse to change passwords.

configboolean.name: strengthtests
configboolean.desc: Should strength tests be done on the new password

configboolean.name: full_name
configboolean.desc: If this is checked, the full user name is used to change the password, the user name without the domain part otherwise. This setting is overridden by enabling the hook below.

configboolean.name: default_username
configboolean.desc: Use a custom hook for determining the default username

configboolean.name: username
configboolean.desc: Use a custom hook to translate the username for the backend

configboolean.name: userdn
configboolean.desc: If we are using the LDAP driver, use a custom hook to provide a userdn for binding. By default the LDAP driver finds out the correct userdn for binding by searching for the uid with the configured base or binds with admindn if set.
